@Jeff32619994 An example of an adjustment due to a corporate action would be in the case of a reverse stock split - your original cost stays the same, but the number of shares is reduced, so the cost basis would increase. ^ZB
@Jeff32619994 Cost basis is calculated per IRS regulation. It would likely not be an additional charge on top of commission, which is why I recommended contacting us so we can take a look. ^ZB

@Jeff32619994 Your cost basis is your purchase price, including any commissions, fees, wash sales, or adjustments for corporate actions. Your cost basis is what determines your gain or loss. To view what is raising your cost basis, follow the path above, or call us. ^ZB
